intro: Eschweilera miersii, commonly known as the Miers' eschweilera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lecanodermataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Eschweilera miersii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
